channel.title: NYT > Top Stories

item.title: Truss Takes a Bold Economic Gamble. Will It Sink Her Government?
item.description: Three weeks into her term, Prime Minister Liz Truss’s financial plans have thrown the markets and Britain’s currency into chaos and put her future in peril.
item.dc:creator: Mark Landler
item.media:credit: Tolga Akmen/EPA, via Shutterstock
item.media:description: Support for the Conservative Party, led by Prime Minister Liz Truss, has plunged in the polls.

item.title: At least 150,000 Leave Russia After Putin Announced Partial Military Mobilization
item.dc:creator: Matthew Mpoke Bigg
item.media:credit: Irakli Gedenidze/Reuters
item.media:description: Georgian police officers blocked opposition activists who were holding a rally near the Russian border on Wednesday to support Ukrainians and protest against the arrival of Russian citizens.

item.title: Activists Flood Election Offices With Challenges
item.description: Groups fueled by right-wing election conspiracy theories are trying to toss tens of thousands of voters from the rolls. “They are just going to beat the system into the ground,” said one election official.
item.dc:creator: Nick Corasaniti and Alexandra Berzon
item.media:credit: Audra Melton for The New York Times
item.media:description: Voters at a polling place during Georgia’s 2021 runoff election, which sent two Democrats, Jon Ossoff and Raphael Warnock, to the Senate.

item.title: Blake Masters Strains to Win Over Arizona Independent Voters
item.description: Blake Masters appears to struggling among independent voters, who make up about a third of the state’s electorate. In interviews, more than one called him a “flip-flopper.”
item.dc:creator: Jazmine Ulloa
item.media:credit: Adriana Zehbrauskas for The New York Times
item.media:description: Blake Masters trails Senator Mark Kelly, a Democrat, in polls, and has struggled to expand his support beyond Arizona’s Republican base.

item.title: Stuck on the Streets of San Francisco in a Driverless Car
item.description: A reporter and a photographer went for a ride in an experimental autonomous vehicle operated by the General Motors subsidiary Cruise. There were bumps in the road.
item.dc:creator: Cade Metz

item.title: Tensions in Iran Spill Across the Border Into Iraq
item.description: The Revolutionary Guards Corps has been attacking Kurdish opposition groups in northern Iraq, blaming them for fomenting the unrest in Iran that was set off by the death of Mahsa Amini.
item.dc:creator: Cora Engelbrecht
item.media:credit: Ako Rasheed/Reuters
item.media:description: Smoke rose from the Iraqi Kurdistan headquarters of the Kurdish Democratic Party of Iran on the outskirts of Kirkuk, Iraq, on Wednesday.

item.title: Whoopi Goldberg Will Not Shut Up, Thank You Very Much
item.description: No matter​ ​how often​ ​she gets​ ​into trouble,​ ​she refuses to hold anything back.
item.dc:creator: Jazmine Hughes
item.media:credit: Ruth Ossai for The New York Times

item.title: Chinese Billionaire Richard Liu Faces Sexual Assault Trial in the US
item.description: Richard Liu, also known as Liu Qiangdong, will be one of the few high-profile Chinese figures to face a courtroom jury over sexual assault allegations.
item.dc:creator: Amy Qin
item.media:credit: Caroline Yang for The New York Times
item.media:description: Liu Jingyao filed a civil suit accusing the Chinese tech billionaire Richard Liu of raping her in Minneapolis in 2018.

item.title: At 86, Jacques Pépin Isn’t Slowing Down
item.description: The celebrated chef lives in Madison, Conn., on a property with two kitchens, an herb-and-vegetable garden and a dog named Gaston. And yes, he has a new cookbook out.
item.dc:creator: Joanne Kaufman
item.media:credit: Tony Cenicola/The New York Times

item.title: The Eagerness of Ginni Thomas
item.description: How has someone with such contempt for democracy, not to mention a shaky grip on reality, run amok for so long at top levels of politics and government?
item.dc:creator: Michelle Cottle
item.media:credit: Susan Walsh/Associated Press

item.title: Seven Years of Trump Has the Right Wing Taking the Long View
item.description: All is not well with democracy in America.
item.dc:creator: Thomas B. Edsall
item.category: Strangers in Their Own Land: Anger and Mourning on the American Right (Book)
item.media:credit: Doug Mills/The New York Times

item.title: After Dobbs: What Is Feminist Sex?
item.description: Michelle Goldberg and Nona Willis Aronowitz on what sexual liberation really means for feminism.
item.dc:creator: ‘The Argument’
item.media:credit: Getty Images

item.title: Which Midterm Polls Should We Be Taking With a Grain of Salt?
item.description: Three writers on whether Democrats should get their hopes up.
item.dc:creator: Frank Bruni, Patrick Ruffini and Amy Walter
item.media:credit: Illustration by Shoshana Schultz/The New York Times; photographs by Bettmann, Samuel Corum, Scott Eisen, hudiemm and Megan Varner, via Getty

item.title: Iran Has Lost Sight of Its Greatest Asset: Women
item.description: In Iran, the forced hijab has become a visible symbol of a basic human right that has been taken away.
item.dc:creator: Firoozeh Dumas
item.media:credit: Anushree Fadnavis/Reuters
item.media:description: A memorial for Mahsa Amini, the 22-year-old Iranian woman who died after Iran’s morality police detained her for wearing her hijab in an “improper” way.

item.title: Why Have We Allowed Money to Ruin Youth Sports?
item.description: An interview with Linda Flanagan, the author of “Take Back the Game.”
item.dc:creator: Jessica Grose
item.media:credit: Eleanor Davis

item.title: Putin’s War Is a Crime Against the Planet
item.description: To fully see the destructive impact of the Ukraine war, listen to the Indigenous people who are guardians of some of the world’s remote ecosystems.
item.dc:creator: Thomas L. Friedman
item.media:credit: Carl De Souza/Agence France-Presse — Getty Images

item.title: Bring On the Women’s Revolutions
item.description: A regime that will not give relief to women deserves no relief from sanctions.
item.dc:creator: Bret Stephens
item.category: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
item.media:credit: Maxim Shipenkov/EPA, via Shutterstock

item.title: Covid Boosters
item.description: Who should get a Covid booster, and when? We answer the big questions.
item.dc:creator: David Leonhardt
item.media:credit: Kim Raff for The New York Times
item.media:description: Administering Covid boosters in Salt Lake City this month.

item.title: An Iranian Uprising Led by Women
item.description: The fury unleashed by the death in police custody of 22-year-old Mahsa Amini has fueled protests and condemnation.
item.dc:creator: Michael Barbaro, Rachelle Bonja, Eric Krupke, Mooj Zadie, Nina Feldman, Lisa Chow, Liz O. Baylen, Marion Lozano, Brad Fisher and Chris Wood
item.media:credit: Getty Images
item.media:description: A rally in Tehran this month. Information about the protests remains partial at best, but witnesses say they are widespread and vitriolic. The authorities also seem to be mounting an escalating crackdown.

item.title: Three Spots to Try if You Don’t Mind a Line
item.description: Join the queue for tacos, circular croissants and chile chicken.
item.dc:creator: Nikita Richardson
item.media:credit: Adam Friedlander for The New York Times
item.media:description: Since opening in 2021, lines have trailed down the block outside Taquería Ramirez for its Mexico City-style street tacos.

item.title: Are Political Winds Blowing in Republicans’ Favor Again?
item.description: There are some signs of a drift toward issues where the party has an advantage, like the economy and immigration.
item.dc:creator: Nate Cohn
item.media:credit: Gabby Jones for The New York Times
item.media:description: Food prices, stock prices and other economic factors may be top priorities for voters in November.

item.title: Meteorologist Erick Adame’s Firing Over Online Sex Prompts Backlash
item.description: Spectrum News NY1 fired Erick Adame after someone took nude pictures of him performing on an adult webcam site and sent them to his employer and his mother.
item.dc:creator: Liam Stack
item.media:credit: Andres Kudacki for The New York Times
item.media:description: Erick Adame was fired from his job as a popular meteorologist after someone began sending nude pictures of him to his employer.

item.title: MacKenzie Scott May No Longer Have a Partner in Philanthropy
item.description: The billionaire’s second husband, a teacher, does not appear on her public profile anymore.
item.dc:creator: Nicholas Kulish and Rebecca R. Ruiz

item.title: Zambia and Its New President Are Still on Their Honeymoon
item.description: Hakainde Hichilema is hailed as a miracle worker for turning around the fortunes of the southern African country. But with his opposition neutralized and a corruption drive focused on his predecessors, some are uneasy.
item.dc:creator: Ruth Maclean
item.media:credit: Gulshan Khan for The New York Times

item.title: The Health Benefits of Chia Seeds
item.description: Chia seeds are back (again) — and nutritionists and doctors say there are good reasons for it.
item.dc:creator: Dani Blum
item.media:credit: Adam Friedlander for The New York Times

item.title: Is It Better to Cook With Coconut Oil or Olive Oil?
item.description: Proponents of coconut oil point out that it is rich in phytochemicals with healthful properties. But so is olive oil.
item.dc:creator: Sophie Egan
item.media:credit: Andrew Scrivani for The New York Times

item.title: How Much Sugar Is in a Glass of Wine?
item.description: Winemakers may add sugar to wine to “improve” the taste, and sugar content can vary widely.
item.dc:creator: Sophie Egan
item.media:credit: Tony Cenicola/The New York Times

item.title: Is Alkaline Water Really Better for You?
item.description: What’s behind the claims that alkaline water will “energize” and “detoxify” the body and lead to “superior hydration”?
item.dc:creator: Alice Callahan
item.media:credit: iStock

item.title: Testosterone Levels: Can Specific Foods or Diets Boost Them?
item.description: What you eat or drink may affect levels of the male sex hormone, but whether a diet can increase libido or energy depends on many things.
item.dc:creator: Randi Hutter Epstein, M.D.
item.media:credit: Aileen Son for The New York Times

item.title: Street Style From Milan Fashion Week
item.description: TikTok, K-pop and fashion student stars light up the city.
item.dc:creator: Simbarashe Cha and Sophie Butcher

item.title: How to Solve Beginner Crosswords
item.description: Get started solving the Mini, Monday and Tuesday puzzles.
item.dc:creator: Jackie Frere and Isaac Aronow
item.media:credit: Thomas Merceron
